text.p: The following are the leading stories in the local press on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- The Blantyre City Council has been taken to court by a construction company, Norse International, which is claiming damages for loss of business over remarks Town Clerk Don Alufandika made on radio.
- Government has invited all the unions in the public sector for discussion in Lilongwe next week in an effort to resolve the strike by civil servants which started nearly five weeks ago.

- The High Court is to re-open the case in which it ruled against the opposition Malawi Congress Party (MCP) and Alliance for Democracy (AFORD) after both parties had applied for a stay of the Blantyre City Centre by-elections.
